life adventure of nicholas nickleby containing faithful account of fortune misfortune uprising downfallings complete career of nickelby family by charles dickens author preface story be begun within few month after publication of completed pickwick paper there be then good many cheap yorkshire school in existence there be very few now of monstrous neglect of education in england disregard of by state a mean of forming good bad citizen miserable happy men private school long afforded notable example although man who have proved unfitness for other occupation in life be free without examination qualification to open school anywhere although preparation for function undertook be required in surgeon who assisted to bring boy into world might one day assist perhaps to send out of in chemist attorney butcher baker candlestick maker whole round of craft trade schoolmaster excepted although schoolmaster a race be blockhead impostor who might naturally be expected to spring from such state of thing to flourish in yorkshire schoolmaster be lowest most rotten round in whole ladder trader in avarice indifference imbecility of parent helplessness of child ignorant sordid brutal men to whom few considerate person must have entrusted board lodging of horse dog formed worthy cornerstone of structure for absurdity magnificent high minded laissez aller neglect have rarely be exceeded in world hear sometimes of action for damage against unqualified medical practitioner who have deformed broken limb in pretending to heal what of hundred of thousand of mind have be deformed for ever by incapable pettifogger who have pretended to form make mention of race a of yorkshire schoolmaster in past tense though have not yet finally disappeared be dwindling daily long day work remains to be done about in way of education heaven know great improvement facility towards attainment of good one have be furnished of late year can not call to mind now how came to hear about yorkshire school when be not very robust child sitting in bye place near rochester castle with head full of partridge strap tom pipe sancho panza know that first impression of be picked up at time that be somehow other connected with suppurated abscess that boy have come home with in consequence of yorkshire guide philosopher friend having ripped open with inky pen knife impression made upon however made never left be always curious about yorkshire school fell long afterwards at sundry time into way of hearing more about at last having audience resolved to write about with intent went down into yorkshire before began book in very severe winter time be pretty faithfully described herein a wanted to see schoolmaster two be forewarned that gentleman might in modesty be shy of receiving visit from author of pickwick paper consulted with professional friend who have yorkshire connexion with whom concerted pious fraud gave letter of introduction in name think of travelling companion bore reference to supposititious little boy who have be left with widowed mother who did know what to do with poor lady have thought a mean of thawing tardy compassion of relation in behalf of sending to yorkshire school be poor lady friend travelling way if recipient of letter must inform of school in neighbourhood writer must be very much obliged went to several place in part of country where school to be most plentifully sprinkled have occasion to deliver letter until came to certain town will be nameless person to whom be addressed be not at home came down at night through snow to inn where be staying be after dinner needed little persuasion to sit down by fire in warm corner take share of wine be on table be afraid be dead now recollect be jovial ruddy broad faced man that got acquainted directly that talked on kind of subject except school showed great anxiety to avoid be there large school near asked in reference to letter oh yes said there be pratty big 'un be good one asked ey said be a good a anoother be ' matther of opinion fell to looking at fire staring round room whistling little on reverting to other topic that have be discussing recovered immediately though tried again again never approached question of school even if be in middle of laugh without observing that countenance fell that became uncomfortable at last when have passed couple of hour so very agreeably suddenly took up hat leaning over table looking full in face said in low voice weel misther have be vara pleasant toogather ar will spak moind tiv'ee dinnot let weedur send lattle boy to yan o ' school measthers while there be harse to hoold in lunnun gootther to lie asleep in ar must mak ' ill word amang neeburs ar speak tiv'ee quiet loike be dom 'd if ar can gang to bed not tellee for weedur sak ' to keep lattle boy from sike scoondrels while there be harse to hoold in lunnun gootther to lie asleep in repeating word with great heartiness with solemnity on jolly face made look twice a large a before shook hand went away never saw afterwards sometimes imagine that descry faint reflection of in john browdie in reference to gentry may here quote few word from original preface to book have afforded author great amusement satisfaction during progress of work to learn from country friend from variety of ludicrous statement concerning in provincial newspaper that more than one yorkshire schoolmaster lay claim to being original of mr squeers one worthy have reason to believe have actually consulted authority learned in law a to having good ground on to rest action for libel have meditated journey to london for express purpose of committing assault battery on traducer third perfectly remembers being waited on last january twelve month by two gentleman one of whom held in conversation while other took likeness although mr squeers have one eye have two published sketch doe not resemble whoever may be in other respect still friend neighbour know at once for whom be meant because character be so like while author can not feel full force of compliment thus conveyed to venture to suggest that contention may arise from fact that mr squeers be representative of class not of individual where imposture ignorance brutal cupidity be stock in trade of small body of men one be described by characteristic fellow will recognise something belonging to will have misgiving that portrait be own author object in calling public attention to system must be very imperfectly fulfilled if did not state now in own person emphatically earnestly that mr squeers school be faint feeble picture of existing reality purposely subdued kept down lest must be deemed impossible that there be upon record trial at law in damage have be sought a poor recompense for lasting agony disfigurement inflicted upon child by treatment of master in place involving such offensive foul detail of neglect cruelty disease a writer of fiction must have boldness to imagine since have be engaged upon adventure have received from private quarter far beyond reach of suspicion distrust account of atrocity in perpetration of upon neglected repudiated child school have be main instrument very far exceeding appear in page comprises need say on subject except if have seen occasion have resolved to reprint few of detail of legal proceeding from certain old newspaper one other quotation from same preface may serve to introduce fact that reader may think curious to turn to more pleasant subject may be right to say that there be two character in book be drawn from life be remarkable that what call world be so very credulous in what professes to be true be most incredulous in what professes to be imaginary while day in real life will allow in one man blemish in virtue will seldom admit very strongly marked character either good bad in fictitious narrative to be within limit of probability who take interest in tale will be glad to learn that brother cheeryble live that liberal charity singleness of heart noble nature unbounded benevolence be creation of author brain be prompting day oftenest by stealth munificent generous deed in town of be pride honour if be to attempt to sum up thousand of letter from sort of people in sort of latitude climate unlucky paragraph brought down upon must get into arithmetical difficulty from must not easily extricate suffice to say that believe application for loan gift office of profit have be requested to forward to original of brother cheeryble with whom never interchanged communication in life must have exhausted combined patronage of lord chancellor since accession of house of brunswick must have broken rest of bank of england brother be now dead there be only one other point on must desire to offer remark if nicholas be not always found to be blameless agreeable be not always intended to appear so be young man of impetuous temper of little experience saw reason why hero must be lifted out of nature chapter introduces rest there once lived in sequestered part of county of devonshire one mr godfrey nickleby worthy gentleman who taking into head rather late in life that must get married not being young enough rich enough to aspire to hand of lady of fortune have wedded old flame out of mere attachment who in turn have taken for same reason thus two people who can not afford to play card for money sometimes sit down to quiet game for love ill conditioned person who sneer at life matrimonial may perhaps suggest in place that good couple must be better likened to two principal in sparring match who when fortune be low backer scarce will chivalrously set to for mere pleasure of buffeting in one respect indeed comparison must hold good for a adventurous pair of five court will afterwards send round hat trust to bounty of looker on for mean of regaling so mr godfrey nickleby partner honeymoon being over looked out wistfully into world relying in inconsiderable degree upon chance for improvement of mean mr nickleby income at period of marriage fluctuated between sixty eighty pound per annum there be people enough in world heaven know even in london where mr nickleby dwelt in day few complaint prevail of population being scanty be extraordinary how long man may look among crowd without discovering face of friend be le true mr nickleby looked looked till eye became sore a heart friend appeared when growing tired of search turned eye homeward saw very little there to relieve weary vision painter who have gazed too long upon glaring colour refreshes dazzled sight by looking upon darker more sombre tint everything met mr nickleby gaze wore so black gloomy hue that must have be beyond description refreshed by very reverse of contrast at length after five year when mr nickleby have presented husband with couple of son embarrassed gentleman impressed with necessity of making provision for family be seriously revolving in mind little commercial speculation of insuring life next quarter day then falling from top of monument by accident there came one morning by general post black bordered letter to inform how uncle mr ralph nickleby be dead have left bulk of little property amounting in to five thousand pound sterling a deceased have taken no further notice of nephew in lifetime than sending to eldest boy who have be christened after on desperate speculation silver spoon in morocco case a have not too much to eat with seemed kind of satire upon having be born without useful article of plate in mouth mr godfrey nickleby must at first scarcely believe tidings thus conveyed to on examination however turned out to be strictly correct amiable old gentleman seemed have intended to leave whole to royal humane society have indeed executed will to effect institution having be unfortunate enough few month before to save life of poor relation to whom paid weekly allowance of three shilling sixpence have in fit of very natural exasperation revoked bequest in codicil left to mr godfrey nickleby with special mention of indignation not only against society for saving poor relation life against poor relation also for allowing to be saved with portion of property mr godfrey nickleby purchased small farm near dawlish in devonshire whither retired with wife two child to live upon best interest must get for rest of money little produce must raise from land two prospered so well together that when died fifteen year after period five after wife be enabled to leave to eldest son ralph three thousand pound in cash to youngest son one thousand farm be a small landed estate a one must desire to see two brother have be brought up together in school at exeter being accustomed to go home once week have often heard from mother lip long account of father suffering in day of poverty of deceased uncle importance in day of affluence recital produced very different impression on two for while younger who be of timid retiring disposition gleaned from thence nothing forewarning to shun great world attach to quiet routine of country life ralph elder deduced from often repeated tale two great moral that rich be only true source of happiness power that be lawful just to compass acquisition by mean short of felony 'and reasoned ralph with 'if good came of uncle money when be alive great deal of good came of after be dead inasmuch a father have got now be saving up for be highly virtuous purpose going back to old gentleman good did come of to too for have pleasure of thinking of life long of being envied courted by family besides ralph always wound up mental soliloquy by arriving at conclusion that there be nothing like money not confining to theory permitting faculty to rust even at early age in mere abstract speculation promising lad commenced usurer on limited scale at school putting out at good interest small capital of slate pencil marble gradually extending operation until aspired to copper coinage of realm in speculated to considerable advantage did trouble borrower with abstract calculation of figure reference to ready reckoner simple rule of interest being comprised in one golden sentence 'two penny for half penny ' greatly simplified account a familiar precept more easily acquired retained in memory than known rule of arithmetic can not be too strongly recommended to notice of capitalist large small more especially of money broker bill discounter indeed to do gentleman justice many of be to day in frequent habit of adopting with eminent success in like manner did young ralph nickleby avoid minute intricate calculation of odd day nobody who have worked sum in simple interest can fail to have found most embarrassing by establishing one general rule that sum of principal interest must be paid on pocket money day be to say on saturday that whether loan be contracted on monday on friday amount of interest must be in case same indeed argued with great show of reason that ought to be rather more for one day than for five inasmuch a borrower might in former case be very fairly presumed to be in great extremity otherwise must not borrow at with such odds against fact be interesting a illustrating secret connection sympathy always exist between great mind though master ralph nickleby be not at time aware of class of gentleman before alluded to proceed on just same principle in transaction from what have said of young gentleman natural admiration reader will immediately conceive of character may perhaps be inferred that be to be hero of work will presently begin to set point at rest for once for ever hasten to undeceive stride to commencement on death of father ralph nickleby who have be time before placed in mercantile house in london applied passionately to old pursuit of money getting in speedily became so buried absorbed that quite forgot brother for many year if at time recollection of old playfellow broke upon through haze in lived for gold conjures up mist about man more destructive of old sens lulling to feeling than fume of charcoal brought along with companion thought that if be intimate must want to borrow money of so mr ralph nickleby shrugged shoulder said thing be better a be a for nicholas lived single man on patrimonial estate until grew tired of living alone then took to wife daughter of neighbouring gentleman with dower of one thousand pound good lady bore two child son daughter when son be about nineteen daughter fourteen a near a can guess impartial record of young lady age being before passing of new act nowhere preserved in registry of country mr nickleby looked about for mean of repairing capital now sadly reduced by increase in family expense of education bepeculate with ' said mr nickleby u late dear ' said mr nickleby a though in doubt 'why not asked mr nickleby 'because dear if must lose ' rejoined mr nickleby who be slow time taking speaker 'if must lose will no longer be able to live dear ' 'fiddle said mr nickleby ' be not altogether sure of dear ' said mr nickleby 'there be nicholas pursued lady 'quite young man be time be in way of doing something for kate too poor girl without penny in world think of brother must be what be if have speculated ' 'that be true ' replied mr nickleby havery good dear yes will speculate dear speculation be round game player see little nothing of card at first starting gain may be great so may loss run of luck went against mr nickleby mania prevailed bubble burst four stock broker took villa residence at florence four hundred nobody be ruined among mr nickleby 'the very house live in sighed poor gentleman be taken from tomorrow not article of old furniture will be sold to stranger last reflection hurt so much that took at once to bed apparently resolved to keep at event up sir ' said apothecary 'you must let be cast down sir ' said nurse beuch thing happen day remarked lawyer be very sinful to rebel against ' whispered clergyman what man with family ought to do ' added neighbour mr nickleby shook head motioning out of room embraced wife child having pressed by turn to languidly beating heart sunk exhausted on pillow be concerned to find that reason went astray after for babbled for long time about generosity goodness of brother merry old time when be at school together fit of wandering past solemnly commended to one who never deserted widow fatherless child smiling gently on turned upon face observed that thought must fall asleep chapter of mr ralph nickleby establishment undertaking of great joint stock company of vast national importance mr ralph nickleby be not strictly speaking what must call merchant neither be banker attorney special pleader notary be certainly not tradesman still le must lay claim to title of professional gentleman for must have be impossible to mention recognised profession to belonged nevertheless a lived in spacious house in golden square in addition to brass plate upon street door have brass plate two size half smaller upon left hand door post surrounding brass model of infant fist grasping fragment of skewer displaying word 'office be clear that mr ralph nickleby did pretended to do business of kind fact if required further circumstantial evidence be abundantly demonstrated by diurnal attendance between hour of half past nine five of sallow faced man in rusty brown who sat upon uncommonly hard stool in specie of butler pantry at end of passage always have pen behind ear when answered bell although few member of graver profession live about golden square be not exactly in anybody way to from anywhere be one of square have be quarter of town have gone down in world taken to letting lodging many of first second floor be let furnished to single gentleman take boarder besides be great resort of foreigner dark complexioned men who wear large ring heavy watch guard bushy whisker who congregate under opera colonnade about box office in season between four five in afternoon when give away order live in golden square within street of two three violin wind instrument from opera band reside within precinct boarding house be musical note of piano harp float in evening time round head of mournful statue guardian genius of little wilderness of shrub in centre of square on summer night window be thrown open group of swarthy moustached men be seen by passer by lounging at casement smoking fearfully sound of gruff voice practising vocal music invade evening silence fume of choice tobacco scent air there snuff cigar german pipe flute violin violoncello divide supremacy between be region of song smoke street band be on mettle in golden square itinerant glee singer quaver involuntarily a raise voice within boundary must not seem spot very well adapted to transaction of business mr ralph nickleby have lived there notwithstanding for many year uttered complaint on score knew nobody round about nobody knew although enjoyed reputation of being immensely rich tradesman held that be sort of lawyer other neighbour opined that be kind of general agent of guess be a correct definite a guess about other people affair usually be need to be mr ralph nickleby sat in private office one morning ready dressed to walk abroad wore bottle green spencer over blue coat white waistcoat grey mixture pantaloon wellington boot drawn over corner of small plaited shirt frill struggled out a if insisting to show from between chin top button of spencer latter garment be not made low enough to conceal long gold watch chain composed of series of plain ring have beginning at handle of gold repeater in mr nickleby pocket termination in two little key one belonging to watch other to patent padlock wore sprinkling of powder upon head a if to make look benevolent if be purpose must perhaps have done better to powder countenance also for there be something in very wrinkle in cold restless eye seemed to tell of cunning must announce in spite of however might be there be a be alone powder wrinkle eye have smallest effect good bad upon anybody just then be consequently business of ours just now mr nickleby closed account book lay on desk throwing back in chair gazed with air of abstraction through dirty window london house have melancholy little plot of ground behind usually fenced in by four high whitewashed wall frowned upon by stack of chimney in there withers on from year to year crippled tree make show of putting forth few leaf late in autumn when other tree shed theirs drooping in effort lingers on crackled smoke dried till following season when repeat same process perhaps if weather be particularly genial even tempts rheumatic sparrow to chirrup in branch people sometimes call dark yard 'gardens be not supposed that be ever planted rather that be piece of unreclaimed land with withered vegetation of original brick field man think of walking in desolate place of turning to account few hamper dozen broken bottle such like rubbish may be thrown there when tenant first move in nothing more there remain until go away again damp straw taking just a long to moulder a think proper mingling with scanty box stunted everbrowns broken flower pot be scattered mournfully about prey to 'blacks dirt be into place of kind mr ralph nickleby gazed a sat with hand in pocket looking out of window have fixed eye upon distorted fir tree planted by former tenant in tub have once be green left there year before to rot away piecemeal there be nothing very inviting in object mr nickleby be wrapt in brown study sat contemplating with far greater attention than in more conscious mood must have deigned to bestow upon rarest exotic at length eye wandered to little dirty window on left through face of clerk be dimly visible that worthy chancing to look up beckoned to attend in obedience to summons clerk got off high stool to have communicated high polish by countless getting off on presented in mr nickleby room be tall man of middle age with two goggle eye whereof one be fixture rubicund nose cadaverous face suit of clothes if term be allowable when suited not at all much worse for wear very much too small placed upon short allowance of button that be marvellous how contrived to keep on 'be that half past twelve noggs ' said mr nickleby in sharp grating voice more than five twenty minute by noggs be going to add public house clock gentleman taking off white hat be so full of paper that must scarcely stick upon head 'there be not moment to lose have cab at door sir matthew pupker take chair three member of parliament be positively coming have seen two of safely out of bed third who be at crockford night have just gone home to put clean shirt on take bottle two of soda water will certainly be with in time to address of other man of business 'pretty well ' echoed mr bonney finest idea be ever started united metropolitan improved hot muffin crumpet baking punctual delivery company capital five million in five hundred thousand share of ten pound why very name will get share up to premium in ten day 'and when be at premium ' said mr ralph nickleby smiling 'when be know what to do with a well a man alive how to back quietly out at right time ' said mr bonney slapping capitalist familiarly on shoulder 'by bye what very remarkable man that clerk of yours be 'yes poor devil replied ralph drawing on glove newman noggs kept horse hound once ' 'ay ay ' said other carelessly ' continued ralph 'and not many year ago squandered money invested anyhow borrowed at interest in short made first thorough fool of then beggar took to drinking have touch of paralysis then came here to borrow pound a in better day have 'done business with ' said mr bonney with meaning look 'just so replied ralph ' must lend know impatient to be gone however a hurried into hackney cabriolet immediately afterwards perhaps mr nickleby forgot to mention circumstance so unimportant there be great bustle in bishopsgate street within a drew up being windy day dozen men be tacking across road under press of paper bearing gigantic announcement that public meeting must be holden at one o'clock precisely to take into consideration propriety of petitioning parliament in favour of united metropolitan improved hot muffin crumpet baking punctual delivery company capital five million in five hundred thousand share of ten pound sum be duly set forth in fat black figure of considerable size mr bonney elbowed way briskly upstairs receiving in progress many low bow from waiter who stood on landing to show way followed by mr nickleby dived into suite of apartment behind great public room in second of be business looking table several business looking people 'hear ' cried gentleman with double chin a mr bonney presented 'chair gentleman chair ' new comer be received with universal approbation mr bonney bustled up to top of table took off hat ran finger through hair knocked hackney coachman knock on table with little hammer whereat several gentleman cried nodded slightly to other a much a to say what spirited conduct be just at moment waiter feverish with agitation tore into room throwing door open with crash shouted beir matthew pupker ' committee stood up clapped hand for joy while be clapping in came sir matthew pupker attended by two live member of parliament one irish one scotch smiling bowing looking so pleasant that seemed perfect marvel how man must have heart to vote against sir matthew pupker especially who have little round head with flaxen wig on top of fell into paroxysm of bow that wig threatened to be jerked off instant when symptom have in degree subsided gentleman who be on speaking term with sir matthew pupker two other member crowded round in three little group near one other of gentleman who be not on speaking term with sir matthew pupker two other member stood lingering smiling rubbing hand in desperate hope of something turning up might bring into notice time sir matthew pupker two other member be relating to separate circle what intention of government be about taking up bill with full account of what government have said in whisper last time dined with how government have be observed to wink when said so from premise be at loss to draw conclusion that if government have one object more at heart than one object be welfare advantage of united platform lady in music gallery in amusement greater portion of have be occupied for couple of hour before a most agreeable diversion pall upon taste on too protracted enjoyment of sterner spirit now began to hammer floor with boot heel to express dissatisfaction by various hoot cry vocal exertion emanating from people who have be there longest naturally proceeded from who be nearest to platform furthest from policeman in attendance who having great mind to fight way through crowd entertaining nevertheless praiseworthy desire to do something to quell disturbance immediately began to drag forth by coat tail collar quiet people near door at same time dealing out various smart tingling blow with truncheon after manner of ingenious actor mr punch whose brilliant example in fashion of weapon use branch of executive occasionally follows several very exciting skirmish be in progress when loud shout attracted attention even of belligerent then there poured on to platform from door at side long line of gentleman with hat off looking behind uttering vociferous cheer cause whereof be sufficiently explained when sir matthew pupker two other real member of parliament came to front amidst deafening shout testified to other in dumb motion that have never seen glorious sight a in whole course of public career at length at last assembly left off shouting sir matthew pupker being voted into chair underwent relapse lasted five minute over sir matthew pupker went on to say what must be feeling on great occasion what must be occasion in eye of world what must be intelligence of fellow countryman before what must be wealth respectability of honourable friend behind lastly what must be importance to wealth happiness comfort liberty very existence of free great people of such institution a united metropolitan improved hot muffin crumpet baking punctual delivery company mr bonney then presented to move first resolution having run right hand through hair planted left in easy manner in rib consigned hat to care of gentleman with double chin who acted a specie of bottle holder to orator generally said must read to first resolution 'that meeting view with alarm apprehension existing state of muffin trade in metropolis neighbourhood that considers muffin boy a at present constituted wholly underserving confidence of public that deems whole muffin system alike prejudicial to health moral of people subversive of best interest of great commercial mercantile community ' honourable gentleman made speech drew tear from eye of lady awakened liveliest emotion in individual present have visited house of poor in various district of london have found destitute of slightest vestige of muffin there appeared too much reason to believe of indigent person did not taste from year end to year end have found that among muffin seller there existed drunkenness debauchery profligacy attributed to debasing nature of employment a at present exercised have found same vice among poorer class of people who ought to be muffin consumer attributed to despair engendered by being placed beyond reach of nutritious article drove to seek false stimulant in intoxicating liquor must undertake to prove before committee of house of common that there existed combination to keep up price of muffin to give bellman monopoly must prove by bellman at bar of house must also prove that men corresponded with other by secret word sign a benooks 'walker ' 'ferguson murphy right many others be melancholy state of thing that company proposed to correct firstly by prohibiting under heavy penalty private muffin trading of description secondly by supplying public generally poor at own home with muffin of first quality at reduced price be with object that bill have be introduced into parliament by patriotic chairman sir matthew pupker be bill that have met to support be supporter of bill who must confer undying brightness splendour upon england under name of united metropolitan improved hot muffin crumpet baking punctual delivery company must add with capital of five million in five hundred thousand share of ten pound mr ralph nickleby seconded resolution gentleman having moved that be amended by insertion of word crumpet ' after word ' whenever occurred be carried triumphantly only one man in crowd cried 'no be promptly taken into custody straightway borne off second resolution recognised expediency of immediately abolishing muffin crumpet seller trader in muffin crumpet of whatsoever description whether male female boy men ringing hand bell otherwise ' be moved by grievous gentleman of semi clerical appearance who went at once into such deep pathetics that knocked first speaker clean out of course in time might have heard pin fall pin feather a described cruelty inflicted on muffin boy by master very wisely urged be in sufficient reason for establishment of inestimable company seemed that unhappy youth be nightly turned out into wet street at most inclement period of year to wander about in darkness rain might be hail snow for hour together without shelter food warmth let public never forget upon latter point while muffin be provided with warm clothing blanket boy be wholly unprovided for left to own miserable resource shame honourable gentleman related one case of muffin boy who having be exposed to inhuman barbarous system for le than five year at length fell victim to cold in head beneath gradually sunk until fell into perspiration recovered must vouch for on own authority have heard have reason to doubt fact of still more heart rending appalling circumstance have heard of case of orphan muffin boy who having be run over by hackney carriage have be removed to hospital have undergone amputation of leg below knee be now actually pursuing occupation on crutch fountain of justice be thing to last be department of subject took meeting be style of speaking to enlist sympathy men shouted lady wept into pocket handkerchief till be moist waved till be dry excitement be tremendous mr nickleby whispered friend that share be thenceforth at premium of five twenty per cent resolution be of course carried with loud acclamation man holding up hand in favour of a must in enthusiasm have held up leg also if must have conveniently accomplished done draft of proposed petition be read at length petition said a petition do say that petitioner be very humble petitioned very honourable object very virtuous therefore said petition bill ought to be passed into law at once to everlasting honour glory of most honourable glorious common of england in parliament assembled then gentleman who have be at crockford night who looked something worse about eye in consequence came forward to tell fellow countryman what speech meant to make in favour of petition whenever must be presented how desperately meant to taunt parliament if rejected bill to inform also that regretted honourable friend have not inserted clause rendering purchase of muffin crumpet compulsory upon class of community opposing half measure preferring to go extreme animal pledged to propose divide upon in committee after announcing determination honourable gentleman grew jocular a patent boot lemon coloured kid glove fur coat collar assist joke materially there be immense laughter much cheering moreover such brilliant display of lady pocket handkerchief a threw grievous gentleman quite into shade when petition have be read be about to be adopted there came forward irish member who be young gentleman of ardent temperament with speech a only irish member can make breathing true soul spirit of poetry poured forth with such fervour that made one warm to look at in course whereof told how must demand extension of great boon to native country how must claim for equal right in muffin law a in other law how yet hoped to see day when crumpet must be toasted in lowly cabin muffin bell must ring in rich green valley after came scotch member with various pleasant allusion to probable amount of profit increased good humour that poetry have awakened speech put together did exactly what be intended to do established in hearer mind that there be speculation so promising at same time so praiseworthy a united metropolitan improved hot muffin crumpet baking punctual delivery company so petition in favour of bill be agreed upon own 'good rejoined ralph 'let have two word with ' two word be have apart in couple of minute mr wackford squeers announced that mr nicholas nickleby be from moment thoroughly nominated to installed in office of first assistant master at dotheboys hall 'your uncle recommendation have done mr nickleby ' said wackford squeers nicholas overjoyed at success shook uncle hand warmly must almost have worshipped squeers upon spot 'he be odd looking man ' thought nicholas 'what of porson be odd looking man so be doctor johnson bookworm be ' 'at eight o'clock tomorrow morning mr nickleby ' said squeers coach start must be here at quarter before a take boy with ' 'certainly sir ' said nicholas 'and fare down have paid ' growled ralph will have nothing to do keep warm ' here be instance of uncle generosity nicholas felt unexpected kindness so much that must scarcely find word to thank indeed have not found half enough when took leave of schoolmaster emerged from saracen head gateway ' will be here in morning to see fairly off ' said ralph 'no skulking ' 'thank sir ' replied nicholas never will forget kindness ' care ' replied uncle have better go home now pack up what have got to pack do think must find way to golden square first 'certainly said nicholas can easily inquire ' 'leave paper with clerk then said ralph producing small parcel 'and tell to wait till come home ' nicholas cheerfully undertook errand bidding worthy uncle affectionate farewell that warm hearted old gentleman acknowledged by growl hastened away to execute commission found golden square in due course mr noggs who have stepped out for minute so to public house be opening door with latch key a reached step 'what be ' inquired noggs pointing to parcel 'papers from uncle ' replied nicholas be to have goodness to wait till come home if please ' 'uncle ' cried noggs nickleby ' said nicholas in explanation 'come in ' said newman without word led nicholas into passage thence into official pantry at end of where thrust into chair mounting upon high stool sat with arm hanging straight down by side gazing fixedly upon a from tower of observation 'there be answer ' said nicholas laying parcel on table beside newman said nothing folding arm thrusting head forward so a to obtain nearer view of nicholas face scanned feature closely 'no answer ' said nicholas speaking very loud under impression that newman be deaf newman placed hand upon knee without uttering syllable continued same close scrutiny of companion face be such very singular proceeding on part of utter stranger appearance be so extremely peculiar that nicholas who have sufficiently keen sense of ridiculous must not refrain from breaking into smile a inquired whether mr noggs have command for noggs shook head sighed upon nicholas rose remarking that required rest bade good morning be great exertion for newman noggs nobody know to day how ever came to make other party being wholly unknown to drew long out of top of eye in most ghastly manner at first nicholas thought mysterious man be in fit on further consideration decided that be in liquor under circumstance deemed prudent to make off at once sens of votary veil daughter veil sister cried alice barter not light air of heaven freshness of earth beautiful thing breathe upon for cold cloister cell nature own blessing be proper good of life may share sinlessly together to die be heavy portion oh let die with life about when cold heart cease to beat let warm heart be beating near let last look be upon bound god have set to own bright sky not on stone wall bar of iron dear sister let live die if list in green garden compass only shun gloom sadness of cloister will be happy 'the tear fell fast from maiden eye a closed impassioned appeal hid face in bosom of sister comfort alice said eldest kissing fair forehead veil will never cast shadow on thy young brow how say sister for yourselves speak not for alice for 'the sister a with one accord cried that lot be cast together that there be dwelling for peace virtue beyond convent wall said eldest lady rising with dignity hear final resolve same pious care enriched abbey of st mary left orphan to holy guardianship directed that constraint must be imposed upon inclination that must be free to live according to choice let hear more of pray sister be nearly noon let take shelter until evening with reverence to friar lady rose walked towards house hand in hand with alice other sister followed 'the holy man who have often urged same point before have never met with so direct repulse walked little distance behind with eye bent upon earth lip moving a if in prayer a sister reached porch quickened pace called upon to stop betay said monk raising right hand in air directing soul when hour arrives mark come will turn from world to clung to refuge spurned find cell will be colder than fire of mortal grows when dimmed by calamity trial there weep for dream of youth thing be heaven will not mine said friar subduing voice a looked round upon shrinking girl virgin blessing be upon daughter word disappeared through postern sister hastening into house be seen no more day nature will smile though priest may frown next day sun shone brightly on next next again in morning glare evening soft repose five sister still walked worked beguiled time by cheerful conversation in quiet orchard passed away a tale be told faster indeed than many tale be told of number fear may be one house of five sister stood where did same tree cast pleasant shade upon orchard grass sister too leader boy take pattern by smike if dare see what will get for when be brought back mind tell that will have a bad twice a bad if so much a open mouth about ' 'if catch ' said squeers `` ll only stop light skirmishing with in rear who be pressing forward to get out of way be detained for few moment by throng in front succeeded in clearing room when confronted spouse alone 'he be off ' said mr squeers cow house stable be locked up so ca be there be not downstairs anywhere for girl have looked must have gone york way by public road too 'why must ' inquired squeers ' said mr squeers angrily have money have ' have penny of own in whole life know of ' replied squeers be sure rejoined mr squeers did take anything to eat with will answer for have have have ' have have ' laughed squeers 'then of course ' said mr s must beg way must do nowhere on public road ' 'that be true ' exclaimed squeers clapping hand yes must never have thought of for if have said so ' replied wife if take chaise go one road borrow swallow chaise go other what with keeping eye open asking question one other of be pretty certain to lay hold of ' worthy lady plan be adopted put in execution without moment delay after very hasty breakfast prosecution of inquiry in village result of seemed to show that be on right track squeers started forth in pony chaise intent upon discovery vengeance shortly afterwards mr squeers arrayed in white top coat tied up in various shawl handkerchief issued forth in chaise direction taking with good sized bludgeon several odd piece of strong cord stout labouring man provided carried upon expedition with sole object of assisting in capture once caught insuring safe custody of unfortunate smike nicholas remained behind in tumult of feeling sensible that might be upshot of boy flight nothing painful deplorable consequence be likely to ensue from death from want exposure to weather be best must be expected from protracted wandering of so poor helpless creature alone unfriended through country of be wholly ignorant there be little perhaps to choose between fate return to tender mercy of yorkshire school unhappy being have established hold upon sympathy compassion made heart ache at prospect of suffering be destined to undergo lingered on in restless anxiety picturing thousand possibility until evening of next day when squeers returned alone unsuccessful 'no news of scamp said schoolmaster who have evidently be stretching leg on old principle not few time during journey `` ll have consolation for out of somebody nickleby if mr squeers hunt down so give warning ' 'it be not in power to console sir ' said nicholas 'it be nothing to ' 'be ' said squeers in threatening manner will see 'we will ' rejoined nicholas 'here be pony run right off leg obliged to come home with hack cob will cost fifteen shilling besides other expense said squeers 'who be to pay for do hear ' nicholas shrugged shoulder remained silent `` ll have out of somebody tell ' said squeers usual harsh crafty manner changed to open bullying 'none of whining vapourings here mr puppy be off to kennel for be past bedtime come get out nicholas bit lip knit hand involuntarily for fingerends tingled to avenge insult remembering that man be drunk that must come to little noisy brawl contented with darting contemptuous look at tyrant walked a majestically a must upstairs not little nettled however to observe miss squeers master squeers servant girl be enjoying scene from snug corner two former indulging in many edifying remark about presumption of poor upstart occasioned vast deal of laughter in even most miserable of miserable servant girl joined while nicholas stung to quick drew over head such bedclothes a have sternly resolved that outstanding account between mr squeers must be settled rather more speedily than latter anticipated day came nicholas be scarcely awake when heard wheel of chaise approaching house stopped voice of mr squeers be heard in exultation ordering glass of spirit for somebody be in sufficient sign that something extraordinary have happened nicholas hardly dared to look out of window did so very first object that met eye be wretched smike so bedabbled with mud rain so haggard worn wild for garment being such a scarecrow be ever seen to wear might have be doubtful even then of identity out ' said squeers after have literally feasted eye in silence upon culprit 'bring in bring in ' care ' cried mr squeers a husband proffered assistance 'we tied leg under apron made'em fast to chaise to prevent giving slip again with hand trembling with delight squeers unloosened cord smike to appearance more dead than alive be brought into house securely locked up in cellar until such time a mr squeers must deem expedient to operate upon in presence of assembled school upon hasty consideration of circumstance may be matter of surprise to person that mr mr squeers must have taken so much trouble to repossess of incumbrance of be wont to complain so loudly surprise will cease when be informed that manifold service of drudge if performed by anybody else must have cost establishment ten twelve shilling per week in shape of wage furthermore that runaway be a matter of policy made severe example of at dotheboys hall inasmuch a in consequence of limited extent of attraction there be little inducement beyond powerful impulse of fear for pupil provided with usual number of leg power of using to remain news that smike have be caught brought back in triumph ran like wild fire through hungry community expectation be on tiptoe morning on tiptoe be destined to remain however until afternoon when squeers having refreshed with dinner further strengthened by extra libation so made appearance accompanied by amiable partner with countenance of portentous import fearful instrument of flagellation strong supple wax ended new in short purchased that morning expressly for occasion boy here ' asked squeers in tremendous voice boy be there boy be afraid to speak so squeers glared along line to assure eye drooped head cowered down a did so 'each boy keep place ' said squeers administering favourite blow to desk regarding with gloomy satisfaction universal start never failed to occasion 'nickleby to desk sir ' be remarked by more than one small observer that there be very curious unusual expression in usher face took seat without opening lip in reply squeers casting triumphant glance at assistant look of most comprehensive despotism on boy left room shortly afterwards returned dragging smike by collar rather by fragment of jacket be nearest place where collar must have be have boasted decoration in other place appearance of wretched jaded spiritless object must have occasioned murmur of compassion remonstrance have effect even there for looker on moved uneasily in seat few of boldest ventured to steal look at other expressive of indignation pity be lost on squeers however whose gaze be fastened on luckless smike a inquired according to custom in such case whether have anything to say for 'nothing suppose ' said squeers with diabolical grin smike glanced round eye rested for instant on nicholas a if have expected to intercede look be riveted on desk anything to say ' demanded squeers again giving right arm two three flourish to try power suppleness betand little out of way mr squeers dear have hardly got room enough ' sir ' cried smike 'oh be be ' said squeers will flog within inch of life spare that ' have have ' laughed mr squeers be good 'un ' ' be driven to do ' said smike head under arm administering cuff at epithet doe mean by ' betand aside dear ' replied squeers will try find out mr squeers being out of breath with exertion complied squeers caught boy firmly in grip one desperate cut have fallen on body be wincing from lash uttering scream of pain be raised again again about to fall when nicholas nickleby suddenly starting up cried betop ' in voice made rafter ring 'who cried stop ' said squeers turning savagely round `` said nicholas stepping forward 'this must not go on ' beust not go on ' cried squeers almost in shriek thundered nicholas aghast stupefied by boldness of interference squeers released hold of smike falling back pace two gazed upon nicholas with look be positively frightful ' say must not ' repeated nicholas nothing daunted behall not will prevent ' squeers continued to gaze upon with eye starting out of head astonishment have actually for moment bereft of speech 'you have disregarded quiet interference in miserable lad behalf ' said nicholas have returned answer to letter in begged forgiveness for offered to be responsible that must remain quietly here blame for public interference have brought upon not ' down beggar ' screamed squeers almost beside with rage seizing smike a spoke 'wretch rejoined nicholas fiercely 'touch at peril will not stand by see done blood be up have strength of ten such men a look to yourself for by heaven will not spare if drive on ' betand back cried squeers brandishing weapon ' have long series of insult to avenge ' said nicholas flushed with passion indignation be aggravated by dastardly cruelty practised on helpless infancy in foul den have care for if do raise devil within consequence will fall heavily upon own head have scarcely spoken when squeers in violent outbreak of wrath with cry like howl of wild beast spat upon struck blow across face with instrument of torture raised up bar of livid flesh a be inflicted smarting with agony of blow concentrating into one moment feeling of rage scorn indignation nicholas sprang upon wrested weapon from hand pinning by throat beat ruffian till roared for mercy boy with exception of master squeers who coming to father assistance harassed enemy in rear moved not hand foot mr squeers with many shriek for aid hung on to tail of partner coat endeavoured to drag from infuriated adversary while miss squeers who have be peeping through keyhole in expectation of very different scene darted in at very beginning of attack after launching shower of inkstand at usher head beat nicholas to heart content animating at blow with recollection of having refused proffered love thus imparting additional strength to arm a took after mother in respect be at time one of weakest nicholas in full torrent of violence felt blow more than if have be dealt with feather becoming tired of noise uproar feeling that arm grew weak besides threw remaining strength into dozen finishing cut flung squeers from with force must muster violence of fall precipitated mr squeers completely over adjacent form squeers striking head against in descent lay at full length on ground stunned motionless having brought affair to happy termination ascertained to thorough satisfaction that squeers be only stunned not dead upon point have have unpleasant doubt at first nicholas left family to restore retired to consider what course have better adopt looked anxiously round for smike a left room be nowhere to be seen after brief consideration packed up few clothes in small leathern valise finding that nobody offered to oppose progress marched boldly out by front door shortly afterwards struck into road led to greta bridge when have cooled sufficiently to be enabled to give present circumstance little reflection did not appear in very encouraging light have only four shilling few penny in pocket be something more than two hundred fifty mile from london whither resolved to direct step that might ascertain among other thing what account of morning proceeding mr squeers transmitted to most affectionate uncle lifting up eye a arrived at conclusion that there be remedy for unfortunate state of thing beheld horseman coming towards whom on nearer approach discovered to infinite chagrin to be other than mr john browdie who clad in cord leather legging be urging animal forward by mean of thick ash stick seemed to have be recently cut from stout sapling ' be in mood for more noise riot ' thought nicholas yet do what will will have altercation with honest blockhead perhaps blow two from yonder staff ' in truth there appeared reason to expect result must follow from encounter for john browdie sooner saw nicholas advancing than reined in horse by footpath waited until such time a must come up looking meanwhile very sternly between horse ear at nicholas a came on at leisure young genelman ' said john 'yours said nicholas 'weel have ' met at last observed john making stirrup ring under smart touch of ash stick 'yes replied nicholas hesitating 'come ' said frankly after moment pause 'we parted on very good term last time met be fault believe have intention of offending idea be doing so be very sorry for afterwards will shake hand honds cried good humoured yorkshireman 'ah that weel ' at same time bent down from saddle gave nicholas fist huge wrench be'at be matther wi ' thy feace mun be brokken loike ' 'it be cut ' said nicholas turning scarlet a spoke ' blow returned to giver with good interest too 'noa did 'ee though exclaimed john browdie 'well deane loike for thot ' fact be said dwarf 'dea say thot 'yes have ' replied nicholas that man squeers have beaten soundly be leaving place in consequence ' 'what ' cried john browdie with ecstatic shout that horse quite shied at 'beatten schoolmeasther ho ho ho beatten schoolmeasther who ever heard o ' loike o ' noo giv ' thee hond agean yoongster beatten schoolmeasther dang loov ' thee for't with expression of delight john tellee hoo much cash hast thee gotten ' 'not much ' said nicholas colouring 'but can make enough where there be will there be way know ' john browdie made verbal answer to remark putting hand in pocket pulled out old purse of solid leather insisted that nicholas must borrow from required for present necessity 'dea be afeard mun ' said 'tak eneaf to carry thee whoam thee'lt pay yan day ' warrant nicholas must by mean be prevailed upon to borrow more than sovereign with loan mr browdie after many entreaty that must accept of more observing with touch of yorkshire caution that if did nicholas watched horse rider until disappeared over brow of distant hill then set forward on journey did not travel far afternoon for by time be nearly dark there have be heavy fall of snow not only rendered way toilsome track uncertain difficult to find after daylight save by experienced wayfarer lay that night at cottage where bed be let at cheap rate to more humble class of traveller rising early death in flower of infancy four little girl raised hideous cry burying head in mother lap simultaneously screamed until eight flaxen tail vibrated again mr kenwigs meanwhile clasping alternately to bosom with attitude expressive of distraction miss petowker might have copied at length anxious mother permitted to be soothed into more tranquil state little kenwigses being also composed be distributed among company to prevent possibility of mr kenwigs being again overcome by blaze of combined beauty done lady gentleman united in prophesying that must live for many many year that there gregsbury great member of parliament of manchester building westminster wanted young man to keep paper correspondence in order nicholas be exactly sort of young man that mr gregsbury wanted know what whit more famous than went in into manchester building nicholas turned with address of great mr gregsbury in hand a there be stream of people pouring into shabby house not far from entrance waited until have made way in then making up to servant ventured to inquire if knew where mr gregsbury lived servant be very pale shabby boy who looked a if have slept underground from infancy a very likely have ber gregsbury ' said ber gregsbury lodge here be all right come in ' nicholas thought might a well get in while must so in walked have sooner done so than boy shut door made off be odd enough what be more embarrassing be that along passage along narrow stair blocking up window making dark entry darker still be confused crowd of person with great importance depicted in look who be to appearance waiting in silent expectation of coming event from time to time one man must whisper to neighbour little group must whisper together then whisperer must nod fiercely to other give head relentless shake a if be bent upon doing something very desperate be determined not to be put off whatever happened a few minute elapsed without anything occurring to explain phenomenon a felt own far from walking up gentleman on stair began to walk down with great alacrity to entreat with extraordinary politeness that gentleman nearest street must go first gentleman nearest street retorted with equal courtesy that must think of thing on account did without thinking of inasmuch a other gentleman pressing half dozen among whom be nicholas forward closing up behind pushed not merely up stair into very sitting room of mr gregsbury be thus compelled to enter with most unseemly precipitation without mean of retreat press behind more than filling apartment 'gentlemen said mr gregsbury gentleman said mr gregsbury tossing great bundle of paper into wicker basket at foot throwing back in chair with arm over elbow be dissatisfied with conduct see by newspaper 'yes mr gregsbury be ' said plump old gentleman in violent heat bursting out of throng planting in front eye deceive ' said mr gregsbury looking towards speaker be that old friend pugstyles ' be that man other sir ' replied plump old gentleman 'give hand worthy friend ' said mr gregsbury 'pugstyles dear friend be very sorry to see here ' ' be very sorry to be here sir ' said mr pugstyles conduct mr gregsbury have rendered deputation from constituent imperatively necessary ' conduct pugstyles said mr gregsbury looking round upon deputation with gracious magnanimity conduct have be ever will be regulated by sincere regard for true real interest of great happy country whether look at home abroad whether behold peaceful industrious community of island home river covered with steamboat road with locomotive street with cab sky with balloon of power magnitude hitherto unknown in history of aeronautics in other nation say whether look merely at home stretching eye farther contemplate boundless prospect of enthusiasm must have be cheered to very echo now deputation received with chilling coldness general impression seemed to be that a explanation of mr gregsbury political conduct did not enter quite enough into detail one gentleman in rear did not scruple to remark aloud for purpose savoured rather too much of 'gammon tendency 'the meaning of term gammon ' said mr gregsbury unknown to if mean that grow little too fervid perhaps even hyperbolical in extolling native land admit full justice of remark be proud of free happy country form dilates eye glisten breast heave heart swell bosom burn when call to mind greatness glory ' wish sir remarked mr pugstyles calmly ask few question 'if please gentleman time be yours country country ' said mr gregsbury permission being conceded mr pugstyles proceeded to business 'question number one whether sir did not give voluntary pledge previous to election that in event of being returned must immediately put down practice of coughing groaning in house of common whether did not submit to be coughed groaned down in very first debate of session have since made effort to effect reform in respect whether did not also pledge to astonish government make shrink in shoe whether have astonished made shrink in shoe not ' 'go on to next one dear pugstyles said mr gregsbury 'have explanation to offer with reference to question sir ' asked mr pugstyles inquiry number two whether sir did not likewise give voluntary pledge that must support colleague on occasion whether did not night before last desert vote upon other side because wife of leader on other side have invited mr gregsbury to evening party ' 'go on ' said mr gregsbury 'nothing to say on sir ' asked spokesman 'nothing ' replied mr gregsbury deputation who have only seen at canvassing did not state upon hustings that be firm determined intention to oppose everything proposed to divide house upon question to move for return on subject to place motion on book day in short in own memorable word to play very devil with everything everybody ' with comprehensive inquiry mr pugstyles folded up list of question a did backer mr gregsbury reflected blew nose threw further back in arose from deputation same gentleman who have expressed opinion relative to gammoning nature of introductory speech again made monosyllabic demonstration by growling out besign growl being taken up by constituent will not object at once to resign seat in favour of candidate whom think can better trust ' to mr gregsbury read following reply anticipating request have composed in form of letter before cheering influence of day broad fine honest sun lighted up green pasture dimpled water with semblance of summer while left traveller invigorating freshness of early time of year ground seemed elastic under foot sheep bell be music to ear exhilarated by exercise stimulated by hope pushed onward with strength of lion day wore on bright colour subsided assumed quieter tint like young hope softened down by time youthful feature by degree resolving into calm serenity of age be scarcely le beautiful in slow decline than have be in prime for nature give to time season beauty of own from morning to night a from cradle to grave be succession of change so gentle easy that can scarcely mark progress to godalming came at last here bargained for two humble bed slept soundly in morning be astir though not quite so early a sun again afoot if not with freshness of yesterday still with enough of hope spirit to bear cheerily on be harder day journey than yesterday for there be long weary hill to climb in journey a in life be great deal easier to go down hill than up however kept on with unabated perseverance hill have not yet lifted face to heaven perseverance will not gain summit of at last walked upon rim of devil punch bowl smike listened with greedy interest a nicholas read inscription upon stone reared upon wild spot tell of murder committed there by night grass on stood have steady purpose entered at length upon wide spacious tract of down with variety of little hill plain to change verdant surface here there shot up almost perpendicularly into sky height so steep a to be hardly accessible to sheep goat fed upon side there stood mound of green sloping tapering off so delicately merging so gently into level ground that must scarce define limit hill swelling above other undulation shapely uncouth smooth rugged graceful grotesque thrown negligently side by side bounded view in direction while frequently with unexpected noise there uprose from ground flight of crow who cawing wheeling round nearest hill a if uncertain of course suddenly poised upon wing skimmed down long vista of opening valley with speed of light by degree prospect receded more more on hand a have be shut out from rich extensive scenery so emerged once again upon open country knowledge that be drawing near place of destination gave fresh courage to proceed way have be difficult have loitered on road smike be tired thus twilight have already closed in when turned off path to door of roadside inn yet twelve mile short of portsmouth mile said nicholas leaning with hand on stick looking doubtfully at smike long mile repeated landlord 'be good road inquired nicholas bad ' said landlord a of course being landlord must say ' want to get on ' observed nicholas hesitating ' scarcely know what to do ' let influence ' rejoined landlord must go on if be ' 'must ' asked nicholas with same uncertainty if knew when be well off ' said landlord having said pulled up apron put hand into pocket nicholas in triumphant manner mr nickleby be suddenly seized with forgetfulness of smike real name irresistible tendency to call mr slammons circumstance attributed to remarkable similarity of two name in point of sound beginning with s moreover being spelt with m doubt there might be on point there be none a to being most excellent listener circumstance have considerable influence in placing on very best term inducing mr nickleby to express highest opinion of general deportment disposition thus little circle remained on most amicable agreeable footing until monday morning when nicholas withdrew from for short time seriously to reflect upon state of affair to determine if must upon course of life must enable to support who be so entirely dependent upon exertion mr crummles occurred to more than once although kate be acquainted with whole history of connection with gentleman mother be not foresaw thousand fretful objection on part to seeking livelihood upon stage there be graver reason too against returning to mode of life independently of arising out of spare precarious earnings own internal conviction that must never hope to aspire to great distinction even a provincial actor how must carry sister from town to town place to place debar from other associate than with whom must be compelled almost without distinction to mingle 'it wo do ' said nicholas shaking head ' must try something else be much easier to make resolution than to carry into effect with greater experience of world than have acquired for in short trial with sufficient share of headlong rashness precipitation quality not altogether unnatural at time of life with very slender stock of money still more scanty stock of friend what must do 'egad ' said nicholas `` ll try register office again indeed with one two exception there seemed to be very same placard in window that have seen before there be same unimpeachable master mistress in want of virtuous servant same virtuous servant in want consequent on being flung violently from cabriolet under circumstance already detailed with shattered limb body severely bruised face disfigured by half healed scar pallid from exhaustion of recent pain fever sir mulberry hawk lay stretched upon back on couch to be doomed to be prisoner for week yet to come mr pyke mr pluck sat drinking hard in next room now then varying monotonous murmur of conversation with half smothered laugh while young lord only member of party who be not thoroughly irredeemable who really have kind heart sat beside mentor with cigar in mouth read to by light of piquet come ' be curious to see how eagerly sick man debarred from change of position save mere turning of head from side to side watched motion of friend in progress of game with what eagerness interest played yet how warily coolly address skill be more than twenty time match for adversary who must make little head against even when fortune favoured with good card be not often case sir mulberry won game when companion threw down card refused to play longer thrust forth wasted arm caught up stake with boastful oath same hoarse laugh though considerably lowered in tone have resounded inconvenient 'it be inconvenient ca see ca see anybody ' said master more violently than before 'you know that blockhead ' ' be very sorry sir ' returned man mr nickleby pressed so much sir ' fact be that ralph nickleby have bribed man who being anxious to earn money with view to future favour held door in hand ventured to linger still 'did say whether have business to speak about ' inquired sir call forth utmost energy exertion that smike be capable of summoning to aid without pausing for moment to reflect upon course be taking probability of leading homewards reverse fled away with surprising swiftness constancy of purpose borne upon such wing a only fear can wear impelled by imaginary shout in well remembered voice of squeers who with host of pursuer seemed to poor fellow disordered sens to press hard upon track now left at greater distance in rear now gaining faster faster upon a alternation of hope terror agitated by turn long after have become assured that sound be creation of excited brain still held on at pace even weakness exhaustion must scarcely retard be not until darkness quiet of country road recalled to sense of external object starry sky above warned of rapid flight of time covered with dust panting for breath stopped to listen look about be still silent glare of light in distance casting warm glow upon sky marked where huge city lay solitary field divided by hedge ditch through many of have crashed scrambled in flight skirted road by way have come upon opposite side be late now must scarcely trace by such path a have taken if must hope to regain own dwelling must surely be at time a under cover of darkness by degree became pretty plain even to mind of smike have at first entertained vague childish idea of travelling into country for ten dozen mile then returning homewards by wide circuit must keep clear of london so great be apprehension of traversing street alone lest must again encounter dreaded enemy yielding to conviction thought inspired turned back taking open road though not without many fear misgiving made for london again with scarcely le speed of foot than with have left temporary abode of mr squeers by time re entered at western extremity greater part of shop be closed of throng of people who have be tempted abroad after heat of day few remained in street be lounging home of asked way from time to time by dint of repeated inquiry at length reached dwelling of newman noggs that evening newman have be hunting searching in byway corner for very person who now knocked at door while nicholas have be pursuing same inquiry in other direction be sitting with melancholy air at poor supper when smike timorous uncertain knock reached ear alive to sound in anxious expectant state newman hurried downstairs uttering cry of joyful surprise dragged welcome visitor into passage up stair said not word until have safe in own garret door be shut behind when mixed great mug full of gin water holding to smike mouth a one might hold bowl of medicine to lip of refractory child commanded to drain to last drop newman looked uncommonly blank when found that smike did little more than put lip to mother still holding back 'how can be so foolish be ashamed of how do suppose be ever to get through life if be coward a what do want sir ' said mr nickleby addressing intruder with sort of simpering fetch anybody whoam ecod will begin to spend evening in airnest chapter officiates a kind of gentleman usher in bringing various people together storm have long given place to calm most profound evening be pretty far advanced indeed supper be over process of digestion proceeding a favourably a under influence of complete tranquillity cheerful conversation moderate allowance of brandy water most wise men conversant with anatomy function of human frame will consider that ought to have proceeded when three friend a one might say in civil religious sense with proper deference regard to holy state of matrimony two friend mr mr browdie counting a more than one be startled by noise of loud angry threatenings below stair presently attained so high pitch be conveyed besides in language so towering sanguinary ferocious that must hardly have be surpassed if there have actually be saracen head then present in establishment supported on shoulder surmounting trunk of real live furious most unappeasable saracen turmoil instead of quickly subsiding after first outburst a turmoil not unfrequently do whether in tavern legislative assembly elsewhere into mere grumbling growling squabble increased moment although whole din appeared to be raised by one pair of lung yet that one pair be of so powerful quality repeated such word a becoundrel ' 'rascal 'insolent puppy ' variety of expletive le flattering to party addressed with such great relish strength of tone that dozen voice raised in concert under ordinary circumstance must have made far le uproar created much smaller consternation 'why what be matter said nicholas moving hastily towards door john browdie be striding in same direction when mr browdie turned pale leaning back in chair requested with faint voice to take notice that if ran into danger be intention to fall into hysteric immediately that consequence might be more serious than thought for john looked rather disconcerted by intelligence though there be lurking grin on face at same time being quite unable to keep out of fray compromised matter by tucking wife arm under own thus accompanied following nicholas downstairs with speed passage outside coffee room door be scene of disturbance here be congregated coffee room customer waiter together with two three coachman helper from yard have hastily assembled round young man who from appearance might have be year two older than nicholas who besides having given utterance to defiance just now described seemed to have proceeded to even greater length in indignation inasmuch a foot have other covering than pair of stocking while couple of slipper lay at great distance from head of prostrate figure in opposite corner who bore appearance of having be shot into present retreat by mean of kick complimented by having slipper flung about ear afterwards coffee room customer waiter coachman helper not to mention barmaid who be looking on from behind open sash window seemed at moment if perseverance thought of nicholas last question awakened 'they be not if have come a common beggar might have thrown sixpence to in remembrance of clever knave used to be since try to palm stale trick see inside of jail once more tighten hold upon in interval of hard labour that vagabond be put to there answer to trash take ' with disdainful scowl at object of anger who met eye uttered not word ralph walked away at usual pace without manifesting slightest curiosity to see what became of late companion indeed once looking behind man remained on same spot with eye fixed upon retreating figure until be lost to view then drawing arm about chest a if damp lack of food struck coldly to lingered with slouching step by wayside begged of who passed along ralph in wise moved by what have lately passed further than a have already expressed walked deliberately on turning out of park leaving golden square on right took way through street at west end of town until arrived in particular one in stood residence of madame mantalini name of lady no longer appeared on flaming door plate that of miss knag being substituted in stead bonnet dress be still dimly visible in first floor window by decaying light of summer evening excepting ostensible alteration in proprietorship establishment wore old appearance 'humph muttered ralph drawing hand across mouth with connoisseur like air surveying house from top to bottom 'these people look pretty well ca last long if know of going in good time be safe fair profit too must keep closely in view be ' so nodding head very complacently ralph be did hear knock ' 'oh mr nickleby sir ' said girl up for love of gracious master be done again ' 'done what ' said ralph tartly 'what d 'ye mean ' knew must if be drove to ' cried girl said so all along ' here silly wench ' said ralph catching by wrist carry family matter to neighbour destroying credit of establishment come here do hear girl ' without further expostulation led rather pulled frightened handmaid into house shut door then bidding walk upstairs before followed without more ceremony guided by noise of great many voice talking together passing girl in impatience before have ascended many step ralph quickly reached private sitting room when be rather amazed by confused inexplicable scene in suddenly found there be young lady worker with bonnet without in various attitude expressive of alarm consternation gathered round madame mantalini who be in tear upon one chair others round miss knag who be in opposition tear upon others round mr mantalini who be perhaps most striking figure in whole group for mr mantalini leg be extended at full length upon floor head shoulder be supported by very tall footman who did seem to know what to do with mr mantalini eye be closed face be pale hair be comparatively straight whisker moustache be limp teeth be clenched have little bottle in right hand little tea spoon in left hand arm leg shoulder be stiff powerless yet madame mantalini be not weeping upon body be scolding violently upon chair amidst clamour of tongue perfectly deafening really appeared to have driven unfortunate footman to utmost verge of distraction be matter here ' said ralph pressing forward at inquiry clamour be increased twenty fold astounding string of such shrill contradiction a 'he poisoned ' have beend for doctor `` 'he dying ' 'he be be only pretending ' with various other cry poured forth with bewildering volubility until madame mantalini be seen to address to ralph when female curiosity to know what must say prevailed a part of wandering of sick man word sweetness ' nobody heeded except footman who being startled to hear such awful tone proceeding a be from between very finger dropped master head upon floor with pretty loud crash then without effort to lift up gazed upon bystander a if have done something rather clever than otherwise will however continued madame mantalini drying eye speaking with great indignation before before everybody here for first time once for never will supply man extravagance viciousness again have be dupe fool to long enough in future will support if can then may spend what apothecary have not mixed prussic acid strong enough that must take bottle two to finish work have in hand entered into catalogue of amiable gentleman gallantry deception extravagance infidelity than six time within last fortnight not having once interfered by word deed to save life 'and insist on being separated left to ' said madame mantalini sobbing dare to refuse separation will have one who have scarcely known anything life suffering sorrow presented to man who be told be father whose first act be to signify intention of putting end to short term of happiness of consigning to old
