continued ' dare say be surprised dear sir have listened to recital with so little astonishment be easily explained uncle have be here morning ' nicholas coloured drew back step two 'yes said old exhaustion invariably perform feat of strength requiring great ingenuity muscular power thus wounded prince bandit chief who be bleeding to death too faint to move except to softest music then only upon hand knee will be seen to approach cottage door for aid in such series of writhings twisting with such curling up of leg such rolling over over such getting up tumbling down again a must never be achieved save by very strong man skilled in posture making so natural did sort of performance come to mr snittle timberry on way out of theatre towards tavern where supper be to be holden testified grain by grain mortal part waste withers away so that spirit grows light sanguine with lightening load feeling immortality at hand deems new term of mortal life disease in death life be so strangely blended that death take glow hue of life life gaunt grisly form of death disease medicine never cured wealth never warded off poverty must boast exemption from sometimes move in giant stride sometimes at tardy sluggish pace slow quick be ever sure certain be with faint reference in own mind to disorder though must by mean admit even to that nicholas have already carried faithful companion to deeply mortified by misgiving that have be gulled have have sufficient leisure to reflect upon thing during late retirement at time when careless indolent nature must permit have availed of opportunity slight circumstance too have occurred to increase suspicion wanted very slight circumstance to kindle wrath against sir mulberry disdainful insolent tone in recent conversation only one have held upon subject since period to sir mulberry referred effected thus rejoined friend with cause of dislike against other rankling in breast young man haunted besides with thought of vindictive be source of amusement to did not serve for at such bantering retort a suited company be match for sir mulberry still violent rupture took place returned to town messrs pyke pluck other gentleman recent abstinence young lord to drown indignation remainder of party because wine be of best have nothing to pay be nearly midnight when rushed out wild burning with blood boiling brain on fire to gaming table here encountered party mad like excitement of play hot room glaring light be not calculated to allay fever of time in giddy whirl of noise confusion men be delirious who thought of money not be trusted to go there alone even if such proceeding be strictly proper of mr kenwigs have doubt mr kenwigs have not returned from business there be nobody to take so mr kenwigs first slapped miss assertion for however willing be be very willing to do full justice to handsome face figure of proprietor held countenance of dark gentleman in window to be exquisite abstract idea of masculine beauty circumstance so often give birth acting upon far le excitable more sluggish temperament than be lot of madeline bray admirer nicholas started at dawn of day from restless couch sleep have visited on previous night prepared to make last appeal by whose slight fragile thread only remaining hope of escape depended although to restless ardent mind morning may be fitting season for exertion activity be not always at time that hope be strongest spirit most sanguine buoyant in trying doubtful position youth custom steady contemplation of difficulty surround familiarity with imperceptibly diminish apprehension beget comparative indifference if not vague reckless confidence in relief mean nature of care not to foresee when come fresh upon such thing in morning with dark silent gap between yesterday with link in brittle chain of hope to rivet afresh hot enthusiasm subdued cool calm reason substituted in stead doubt misgiving revive a traveller see farthest by day becomes aware of rugged mountain trackless plain friendly darkness have shrouded from sight mind together so wayfarer in toilsome path of human life see with returning sun new obstacle to surmount new height to be attained distance stretch out before last night be scarcely taken into account light gild nature with cheerful beam seems to shine upon weary obstacle yet lie strewn between grave so thought nicholas when with impatience natural to situation like softly left house feeling a though to remain in bed be to lose most precious time to be up stirring be in way to promote end have in view wandered into london perfectly well knowing that for hour to come must not obtain speech with madeline must hing wish intervening time away even now a paced street listlessly looked round on gradually increasing bustle preparation for day everything appeared to yield new occasion for despondency last night sacrifice of young affectionate beautiful creature to wretch in such cause have seemed thing too monstrous to succeed warmer grew more confident felt that interposition must save from clutch now when thought how regularly thing went on from day to day in same unvarying round how youth beauty died ugly griping age lived tottering on how crafty avarice grew rich manly honest heart be poor sad how few be who tenanted stately house how many of who lay in noisome pen rose day laid down night lived died father son mother child race upon race generation upon generation without home to shelter energy of one single man directed to aid how in seeking not luxurious splendid life bare mean of most wretched inadequate subsistence there be woman child in one town divided into class numbered estimated a regularly a noble family folk of great degree reared from infancy to drive most criminal dreadful trade how ignorance be punished never taught how jail door gaped gallows loomed for thousand urged towards by circumstance darkly curtaining very cradle head for might have earned honest bread lived in peace how many died in soul have chance of life how many who must scarcely go astray be vicious a must turned haughtily from crushed stricken wretch who must scarce do otherwise who must have be greater wonder have done well than even have done ill how much injustice misery wrong there be yet how world rolled on from year to year alike careless indifferent man seeking to remedy redress when thought of selected from mass one slight case on thought be bent felt indeed that there be little ground for hope little reason why must not form atom in huge aggregate of distress sorrow add one small unimportant unit to swell great amount youth be not prone to contemplate darkest side of picture can shift at will by dint of reflecting on what have to do reviving train of thought night have interrupted nicholas gradually summoned up utmost energy when morning be sufficiently advanced for purpose have thought that of using to best advantage hasty breakfast taken such affair of business a sat with elbow on desk sharp cheek bone resting on hand only served to bring out ugly feature in strong relief together with little table at sat to shroud rest of chamber in deep sullen gloom raising eye looking vacantly into gloom a made mental calculation arthur gride suddenly met fixed gaze of man 'thieves thief shrieked usurer starting up folding book to breast 'robbers murder be matter said form advancing off ' cried trembling wretch 'be man what do take if not for man ' be inquiry yes cried arthur gride shading eye with hand 'it be man not spirit be man robber robber 'for what be cry raised unless indeed know have purpose in brain ' said stranger coming close up to ' be thief then how come here ' cried gride somewhat reassured still retreating from visitor 'what be name what do want ' name need not know ' be reply came here because be shown way by servant have addressed twice thrice be too profoundly engaged with book to hear have be silently waiting until must be le abstracted what want will tell when can summon up courage enough to hear understand ' arthur gride venturing to regard visitor more attentively perceiving that be young man of good mien bearing breadth length must have admitted of winding in head with utmost ease without risk of straining old greasy material of be composed so attired in place so far removed from usual haunt occupation so wife mr squeers lord be in tolerably disconsolate mood mr squeers lord appeared to be a helping from black bottle stood on table beside cast round chamber look in very slight regard for object within street into might have penetrated if have thought fit to approach window attic chamber in sat be bare mean bedstead such few other article of necessary furniture a contained be of commonest description in most crazy state of most uninviting appearance street be muddy dirty deserted having one outlet be traversed by few inhabitant at time night being one of on most people be glad to be within door now presented other sign of life than dull glimmering of poor candle from dirty window few sound pattering of rain occasionally heavy closing of creaking door mr squeers continued to look disconsolately about to listen to noise in profound silence broken only by rustling of large coat a now then moved arm to raise glass to lip mr squeers continued to do for time until increasing gloom warned to snuff candle seeming to be slightly roused by exertion raised eye to ceiling fixing upon uncouth fantastic figure traced upon by wet damp have penetrated through roof broke into following soliloquy be pretty go be here uncommon pretty go here have be matter of how many week hard upon six follering up here blessed old dowager petty larcenerer mr squeers delivered of epithet with great difficulty effort 'and dotheboys running regularly to seed while be worst of ever being in with owdacious chap like old nickleby never know when be done with if be in for penny be in for pound ' remark perhaps reminded mr squeers that be in for hundred pound at rate countenance relaxed raised glass to mouth with air of greater enjoyment of content than have before evinced never see ' soliloquised mr squeers in continuation ' never see come across file a old nickleby never be out of everybody depth be be what may call rasper be nickleby to see how sly cunning grubbed on day after towards miss la creevy in stately distant manner designed to mark sense of impropriety of conduct to signify extreme cutting disapprobation of misdemeanour have so flagrantly committed chapter old fascination of love hope warm heart yearned towards plain john browdie remembered first meeting with smile second with tear saw poor smike once again with bundle on shoulder trudging patiently by side heard honest yorkshireman rough word of encouragement a left on road to london madeline sat down very many time jointly to produce letter must acquaint john at full length with altered fortune assure of friendship gratitude so happened however that letter must never be written although applied to with best intention in world chanced that always fell to talking about something else when nicholas tried by found impossible to write one half of what wished to say to pen anything indeed on reperusal did not appear cold unsatisfactory compared with what have in mind at last after going on thus from day to day reproaching more more resolved more readily a madeline strongly urged to make hasty trip into yorkshire present before mr mr browdie without word of notice thus be that between seven eight o'clock one evening kate found in saracen head booking office securing place to greta bridge by next morning coach have to go westward to procure little necessary for journey a be fine night agreed to walk there ride home place have just be in called up so many recollection kate have so many anecdote of madeline nicholas so many anecdote of frank be so interested in what other said be so happy confiding have so much to talk about be not until have plunged for full half hour into labyrinth of street lie between seven dial soho without emerging into large thoroughfare that nicholas began to think just possible might have lost way possibility be soon converted into certainty for on looking about walking first to one end of street then to other must find landmark must recognise be fain to turn back again in quest of place at must seek direction be by street there be nobody about in few wretched shop passed making towards faint gleam of light streamed across pavement from cellar nicholas be about to descend two three step so a to render visible to below make inquiry when be arrested by loud noise of scolding in woman voice 'oh come away said kate 'they be quarrelling will be hurt 'wait one instant kate let hear if there be anything matter returned brother 'hush ' nasty idle vicious good for nothing brute ' cried woman stamping on ground 'why turn mangle be life soul ' replied man voice ' be always turning be perpetually turning like demd old horse in demnition mill life be one demd horrid grind ' why go list for soldier ' retorted woman be welcome to ' soldier ' cried man 'for soldier must joy gladness see in coarse red coat with little tail must hear of being slapped beat by drummer demnebly must have fire off real gun have hair cut whisker shaved eye turned right left trouser pipeclayed ' 'dear nicholas whispered kate 'you know who be be mr mantalini be confident 'do make sure peep at while ask way said nicholas 'come down step two come ' drawing after nicholas crept down step looked into small boarded cellar there amidst clothes basket clothes stripped up to shirt sleeve wearing still old patched pair of pantaloon of superlative make once brilliant waistcoat moustache whisker a of yore lacking lustrous dye there endeavouring to mollify wrath of buxom female not lawful madame mantalini proprietress of concern grinding meanwhile a if for very life at mangle whose creaking noise mingled with shrill tone appeared almost to deafen there be graceful elegant fascinating once dashing 'oh false traitor ' cried lady threatening personal violence on mr mantalini face 'false oh dem now soul gentle captivating bewitching most demnebly enslaving chick biddy be calm ' said mr mantalini humbly wo ' screamed woman `` ll tear eye out ' 'oh what demd savage lamb ' cried mr mantalini 'you be never to be trusted ' screamed woman be out day yesterday gallivanting somewhere know know be be enough that paid two pound fourteen for took out of prison let live here like gentleman must go on like breaking heart besides ' will never break heart will be good boy never do so more will never be naughty again beg little pardon ' said mr mantalini dropping handle of mangle folding palm together 'it be up with handsome friend have gone to demnition bow wow will have pity will not scratch claw pet comfort oh demmit ' very little affected to judge from action by tender appeal lady be on point of returning angry reply when nicholas raising voice asked way to piccadilly mr mantalini turned round caught sight of kate without word leapt at one bound into bed stood behind door drew counterpane over face kicking meanwhile convulsively 'demmit ' cried in suffocating voice 'it little nickleby shut door put out candle turn up in bedstead oh dem dem dem ' woman looked first at nicholas then at mr mantalini a if uncertain on whom to visit extraordinary behaviour mr mantalini happening by ill luck to thrust nose from under bedclothes in anxiety to ascertain whether visitor be gone suddenly with dexterity must only have be acquired by long practice flung pretty heavy clothes basket at with so good aim that kicked more violently than before though without venturing to make effort to disengage head be quite extinguished thinking favourable opportunity for departing before of torrent of wrath discharged upon nicholas hurried kate off left unfortunate subject of unexpected recognition to explain conduct a best must next morning began journey be now cold winter weather forcibly recalling to mind under what circumstance have first travelled that road how many vicissitude change have since undergone be alone inside greater part of way sometimes when have fallen into doze rousing looked out of window recognised place well remembered a having passed on journey down in long walk back with poor smike must hardly believe that have since happened have be dream that be still plodding wearily on towards london with world before to render recollection more vivid came on to snow a night set in passing through stamford grantham by little alehouse where have heard story of bold baron of grogzwig everything looked a if have seen yesterday not even flake of white crust on roof have melted away encouraging train of idea flocked upon must almost persuade that sat again outside coach with squeers boy that heard voice in air that felt again with mingled sensation of pain pleasure now that old sinking of heart longing after home while be yet yielding up to fancy fell asleep dreaming of madeline forgot slept at inn at greta bridge on night of arrival rising at very early hour next morning walked to market town inquired for john browdie house john lived in outskirt now be family man a everbody knew nicholas have difficulty in finding boy who undertook to guide to residence dismissing guide at gate in impatience not even stopping to admire thriving look of cottage garden nicholas made way to kitchen door knocked lustily with stick ' cried voice inside be matther noo be toon fire ding thou makbet noise eneaf ' with word john browdie opened door opening eye too to utmost width cried a clapped hand together burst into hearty roar be godfeyther be godfeyther tilly here be misther nickleby gi ' thee hond mun coom awa ' coom awa ' in wi doon beside fire tak ' soop o ' thot dinnot say word till thoubet droonk ' oop wi mun ding be reeght glod to see thee ' adapting action to text john dragged nicholas into kitchen forced down upon huge settle beside blazing fire poured out from enormous bottle about quarter of pint of spirit thrust into hand opened mouth threw back head a sign to to drink instantly stood with broad grin of welcome overspreading great red face like jolly giant ' might have knowa 'd said john 'that nobody thou must have coom wi ' sike knock a thot be be thou knocked at schoolmeasther door eh have have have say be'at be ' aboot schoolmeasther ' 'you know then ' said nicholas be talking aboot doon toon last neeght replied john 'but neane on 'em seemed quite to un'erstan ' loike ' various shifting delay said nicholas have be sentenced to be transported for seven year for being in unlawful possession of stolen will after have to suffer consequence of conspiracy ' cried john ' conspiracy soom'at in pooder plot be ' eh soom'at in guy faux line ' conspiracy connected with school will explain presently ' be reeght ' said john 'explain arter breakfast not noo for thou be'est hoongry so be tilly mun ' be at bottom o ' explanation for say thot mutual confidence have have have ecod be room start be mutual confidence ' entrance of mr browdie with smart cap on very many apology for having be detected in act of breakfasting in kitchen stopped john in discussion of grave subject hastened breakfast being composed of vast mound of toast new laid egg boiled ham yorkshire pie other cold substantials of heavy relay be constantly appearing from kitchen under direction of very plump servant be admirably adapted to cold bleak morning received utmost justice from party at last came to close fire have be lighted in best parlour having by time burnt up adjourned thither to hear what nicholas have to tell nicholas told never be there story awakened so many emotion in breast of two eager listener at one time honest john groaned in sympathy at roared with joy at one time vowed to go up to london on purpose to get sight of brother cheeryble at swore tim linkinwater must receive ham by coach carriage free a mortal knife have never carved when nicholas began to describe madeline sat with mouth wide open nudging mr browdie from time to time exclaiming under breath that must be tidy sart when heard at last that young friend have come down purposely to communicate good fortune to convey to assurance of friendship must not state with sufficient warmth in writing that only object of journey be to share happiness with to tell that when be married must come up to see madeline insisted on a well a john must hold out no longer after looking indignantly at wife demanding to know what be whimpering for drew coat sleeve over eye blubbered outright 'tell'ee be'at though said john seriously when great deal have be said on side 'to return to schoolmeasther if news aboot 'un have reached school today old 'ooman wea have whole boan in boddy fanny 'oh john ' cried mr browdie oh john agean replied yorkshireman ' dinnot know what lad might do when first got aboot that schoolmeasther be in trouble feythers moothers sent took young chap awa ' if a be left must know waat coom tiv'un there will be sike revolution rebel ding think will ' gang daft spill bluid like wather ' in fact john browdie apprehension be so strong that determined to ride over to school without delay invited nicholas to accompany however declined pleading that presence might perhaps aggravate bitterness of adversity true ' said john ' must ne'er have ' thought o thot ' must return tomorrow ' said nicholas 'but mean to dine with today if mr browdie can give bed ' 'bed cried john wish thou couldst sleep in fower bed at once ecod thou shouldst have 'em ' bide till coom back on ' y bide till coom back ecod will make day of ' giving wife hearty kiss nicholas le hearty shake of hand john mounted horse rode off leaving mr browdie to apply to hospitable preparation young friend to stroll about neighbourhood revisit spot be rendered familiar to by many miserable association john cantered away arriving at dotheboys hall tied horse to gate made way to schoolroom door found locked on inside tremendous noise riot arose from within applying eye to convenient crevice in wall did not remain long in ignorance of meaning news of mr squeers downfall have reached dotheboys be quite clear to appearance have very recently become known to young gentleman for rebellion have just broken out be one of brimstone treacle morning mr squeers have entered school according to custom with large bowl spoon followed by miss squeers amiable wackford who during father absence have taken upon such minor branch of executive a kicking pupil with nailed boot pulling hair of of smaller boy pinching others in aggravating place rendering in various similar way great comfort happiness to entrance whether by premeditation simultaneous impulse be signal of revolt while one detachment rushed to door locked mounted on desk form stoutest consequently newest boy seized cane confronting mr squeers with stern countenance snatched off cap beaver bonnet put on own head armed with wooden spoon bade on pain of death go down upon knee take dose directly before estimable lady must recover offer slightest retaliation be forced into kneeling posture by crowd of shouting tormentor compelled to swallow spoonful of odious mixture rendered more than usually savoury by immersion in bowl of master wackford head whose ducking be intrusted to rebel success of first achievement prompted malicious crowd whose face be clustered together in variety of lank half starved ugliness to further act of outrage leader be insisting upon mr squeers repeating dose master squeers be undergoing dip in treacle violent assault have be commenced on miss squeers when john browdie bursting open door with vigorous kick rushed to rescue shout scream groan hoot clapping of hand suddenly ceased dead silence ensued 'ye be noice chap said john looking steadily round 'what be to do here thou yoong dog bequeers be in prison be going to run away ' cried score of shrill voice wo stop wo stop ' then dinnot stop ' replied john waants thee to stop roon awa ' loike men dinnot hurt woman 'hurrah cried shrill voice more shrilly still 'hurrah repeated john hurrah loike men too noo then look out hip hip hip hurrah ' cried voice agean ' said john 'looder still ' boy obeyed ' said john 'dinnot be afeared on let have good 'un ' 'noo then ' said john 'let have yan more to end wi ' then coot off a quick a loike tak good breath noo squeers be in jail school brokken oop be ' ower past gane think o thot let be hearty hurrah ' such cheer arose a wall of dotheboys hall have never echoed before be destined never to respond to again when sound have died away school be empty of busy noisy crowd have peopled five minute before not one remained havery well mr browdie ' said miss squeers hot flushed from recent encounter vixenish to last 'you have be excited boy to run away now see if pay out for sir if pa be unfortunate trod down by henemies be not going to be basely crowed conquered over by 'tilda ' 'noa replied john bluntly 'thou bea tak ' thy oath o ' thot think betther o ' fanny tell 'ee be auld man have be caught out at last dom 'd glod ye will sooffer eneaf wi'out crowin ' fra be not mun to crow be tilly lass so tell 'ee flat more than thot tell noo that if thou needbet friend to help thee awa from place dinnot turn up thy nose fanny thou maybet thou'lt foind tilly wi ' thout o ' old time aboot ready to lend thee hond when say thot dinnot think be asheamed of waa't have deane for say again hurrah dom schoolmeasther there ' parting word concluded john browdie strode heavily out remounted nag put once more into smart canter carolling lustily forth fragment of old song to horse hoof rang merry accompaniment sped back to pretty wife to nicholas for day afterwards neighbouring country be overrun with boy who report went have be secretly furnished by mr mr browdie not only with hearty meal of bread meat with sundry shilling sixpence to help on way to rumour john always returned stout denial accompanied however with lurking grin rendered suspicious doubtful fully confirmed previous believer there be few timid young child who miserable a have be many a be tear have shed in wretched school still knew other home have formed for sort of attachment made weep when bolder spirit fled cling to a refuge of be found cry under hedge in such place frightened at solitude one have dead bird in little cage have wandered nearly twenty mile when poor favourite died lost courage lay down beside be discovered in yard hard by school sleeping with dog who bit at who came to remove licked sleeping child pale face be taken back other straggler be recovered by degree be claimed lost again in course of time dotheboys hall last breaking up began to be forgotten by neighbour to be only spoken of a among thing have be chapter conclusion when term of mourning have expired madeline gave hand fortune to nicholas on same day at same time kate became mr frank cheeryble be expected that tim linkinwater miss la creevy must have made third couple on occasion declined two three week afterwards went out together one morning before breakfast coming back with merry face be found to have be quietly married that day money nicholas acquired in right of wife invested in firm of cheeryble brother in frank have become partner before many year elapsed business began to be carried on in name of 'cheeryble nickleby ' so that mr prophetic anticipation be realised at last twin brother retired who need to be told that be happy be surrounded by happiness of own creation lived to increase tim linkinwater condescended after much entreaty brow beating to accept share in house must never be prevailed upon to suffer publication of name a partner always persisted in punctual regular discharge of clerkly duty wife lived in old house occupied very bedchamber in have slept for four forty year a wife grew older became even more cheerful light hearted little creature be common saying among friend that be impossible to say looked happier tim a sat calmly smiling in elbow chair on one side of fire brisk little wife chatting laughing constantly bustling in out of hers on other dick blackbird be removed from counting house promoted to warm corner in common sitting room beneath cage hung two miniature of mr linkinwater execution one representing other tim smiling very hard at beholder tim head being powdered like twelfth cake spectacle copied with great nicety stranger detected close resemblance to at first glance leading to suspect that other must be wife emboldening to say so without scruple mr linkinwater grew very proud of achievement in time considered among most successful likeness have ever painted tim have profoundest faith in likewise for on a on other subject held one opinion if ever there be 'comfortable couple ' in world be mr mr linkinwater ralph having died intestate having relation with whom have lived in such enmity must have become in legal course heir must not bear thought of growing rich on money so acquired felt a though must never hope to prosper with made claim to wealth rich for have toiled day burdened soul with so many evil deed be swept at last into coffer of state man be better happier for arthur gride be tried for unlawful possession of will have procured to be stolen have dishonestly acquired retained by other mean a bad by dint of ingenious counsel legal flaw escaped only to undergo worse punishment for year afterwards house be broken open in night by robber tempted by rumour of great wealth be found murdered in bed mr sliderskew went beyond sea at nearly same time a mr squeers in course of nature never returned brooker died penitent sir mulberry hawk lived abroad for year courted caressed in high repute a fine dashing fellow ultimately returning to country be thrown into jail for debt there perished miserably a such high spirit generally do first act of nicholas when became rich prosperous merchant be to buy father old house a time crept on there came gradually about group of lovely child be altered enlarged none of old room be ever pulled down old tree be ever rooted up nothing with there be association of bygone time be ever removed changed within stone throw be retreat enlivened by child pleasant voice too here be kate with many new care occupation many new face courting sweet smile one so like own to mother seemed child again same true gentle creature same fond sister same in love of about a in girlish day mr nickleby lived sometimes with daughter sometimes with son accompanying one other of to london at period when care of business obliged family to reside there always preserving great appearance of dignity relating experience especially on point connected with management bringing up of child with much solemnity importance be very long time before must be induced to receive mr linkinwater into favour be even doubtful whether ever thoroughly forgave there be one grey haired quiet harmless gentleman who winter summer lived in little cottage hard by nicholas house when be not there assumed superintendence of affair chief pleasure delight be in child with whom be child master of revel little people must hing without dear newman noggs grass be green above dead boy grave trodden by foot so small light that not daisy drooped head beneath pressure through spring summertime garland of fresh flower wreathed by infant hand rested on stone when child came to change lest must wither be pleasant to no longer eye filled with tear spoke low softly of poor dead cousin
